shortcut.hint: Special slashcommand, accessible via extension keyboard shortcut
shortcut.description: My preferred keyboard bound slashcommand is the //tab command which just opens a fresh tab. I bind this to ‚å•T.

w.description: Search for widgets by name or id.

stats.description: Open the stats.do page, kinda silly since you can do /stats.do but I like it.

gr.description: Search for groups by name or get to the group table quickly.

mca.description: Open the My Companies Applications page, useful for installing or updating internal apps.

load.description: Opens the load update set page.

ag.description: Opens the Agile Board, about as good as a bookmark, but in a slashcommand.

sla.description: Search for SLA definitions by name, or get to the SLA table quickly.

r.description: Search for roles by name, or get to the role table quickly.

cc.description: Opens the cache.do page, useful for clearing the cache. Use it in conjunction with the /cls command.

dbt.description: Search for Data Broker Server Scripts by name, or get to the Data Broker Server Script table quickly.

aclr.description: Search for ACL Roles Relation by the role name, useful to see which ACLs that a role is affiliated with.

elog.description: Shows the event log for the day, useful for checking if events have been queued and processed.

uxem.hint: UX Add-on Event Mappings for Macroponent
uxem.description: Shows the UX Add-on Event Mappings for the macroponent, useful for checking if events have been mapped correctly or fixing broken mappings. Intended to be run on a macroponent record.

alog.description: Shows the app log for the current scope for the day, way less cluttered than the general instance log.

errorlog.description: Shows the syslog for the day, only showing errors and warnings.

test.description: Example slashcommand to open the the current record in the test environment. Double // invokes another command. Replace test with your instance prefix. (test.service-now.com)

cmptest.hint: Example: Compare to record in Test
cmptest.description: Example slashcommand to open compare the current record with the test environment. Double // invokes another command. Replace test with your instance prefix. (test.service-now.com)

nus.description: Opens a new update set record, for your current scope.

mru.description: Shows the recent updates you have made, useful for checking your updates have been captured and in which update sets.

logtail.description: Opens the logtail channel, useful for tailing the node logs. Can be useful in REST message processing debugging.

rcr.description: Search for roles that contain other roles, useful for checking role hierarchies.

cus.description: Opens the current update set, no longer do you need to go through the header.

nextlog.description: Enables logging in the NextExperience, useful for debugging. Does the same thing as the DEX extension.

retrieve.description: Navigate to the remote instances list to retrieve update sets from lower environments.

sj.description: Search for scheduled jobs by name, or get to the scheduled job table quickly.

event.description: Search for events by name, or get to the event registry table quickly.

noti.description: Search for notifications by name, or get to the notification table quickly.

running.description: Shows the scheduled jobs that are currently running, useful for checking on the completion of scheduled jobs.

ind.description: Search for PA Indicators by name, or get to the indicator table quickly.

pasc.description: Search for PA Scripts by name, or get to the script table quickly.

roll.description: Show the most recent script executions, useful for grabbing code you've previously run in background scripts or rolling back runs.

fix.description: Search for fix scripts by name, or get to the fix script table quickly.

myups.description: Shows the history set captures you have made today, useful grabbing historical values from records when they aren't in the activity formatter and you don't have admin/glide.history.role.

force.hint: Force current record to current update set
force.description: Opens the script editor with a script that will force the current record to your current update set. Needs to switched to global scope to be run, but will place the update in the current update set.

csmrec.hint: Opens the current record in CSM Workspace
csmrec.description: Opens the current record in CSM workspace, super useful when you want to look at a record found using sys_id search or found in platform

awrec.hint: Opens the current record in AW Workspace
awrec.description: Opens the current record in AW Workspace, super useful when you want to look at a record found using sys_id search or found in platform

czn.hint: Filters current table to only show records that have customer updates.
czn.description: Uses a join query to filter the current table to only show records that have customer updates. I would love to make this a switch but the current implementation doesn't support it.

ff.description: Search for UI elements by name, useful for finding which views a field is on.

us.description: Search for update sets by name or get to the update set table quickly.

ms.description: Search for email scripts by name or get to the email script table quickly.

ts.description: Search for document template scripts by name or get to the document template script table quickly.

upa.description: Search for UI policy actions by field, really useful for checking what is showing/hiding a field.

resume.hint: Resume the most recent update set for record
resume.description: Resumes the most recent update set for the current record. Will prompt you if you want to resume the update set if it is not in progress.

sact.description: Search for script actions by event name, useful for finding what scripts are running on an event.

vtb.description: Opens the Visual Task Boards page.

forcepop.hint: Force the always show nav user preference.
